metadata.dc:title: Variations on the Traumatism concept: traumatism, traumatic, trauma
metadata.dc:creator: Bokanowski, Thierry
metadata.dc:description: In continuation to a recollection of Freud´s essential proposals on the concept of traumatism, the writer, using French as a starting point, proposes a differentiation between traumatism and trauma, terms referring to the three courses of the Dreudian theory on the concept of traumatism (1895-1897, 1920 and 1938). The writer also mentions the contributions of S. Ferenczi, who, in his later works (1928-1933), refers to and delimits the question of trauma in present day clinic. Variations of the concept under the prism of psychical functioning are discussed, leading to a specification, from the metapsychological point of view, of the differences between secondary traumatisms, organized under the supremacy of the pleasure/displeasure principle (traumatism), and early and primary traumatisms, which hinder the process of dribe binding (trauma), considering that functioning with traumatic trace (traumatic) is common to the two varieties of advanced traumatisms. The writer presents a clinical vignette to illustrate his ideas (AU)
